DataElement.preferredName: Derkay Recurrent Papillomatosis Result Laryngeal Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Named laryngeal anatomic site examined for recurrent papillomatosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Derkay Staging System Papillomatosis Assessment Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A staging system for assessment of recurrent respiratory papillomatosis (RRP). The staging system includes a functional assessment of severity as well as an anatomic assessment of disease distribution. The anatomic score can then be used in combination with the functional assessment to measure an individual patient's clinical course and response to therapy over time._Glandular or squamous cell neoplastic proliferations characterized by the formation of multiple papillary structures diffusely involving a specific anatomic site._The result of an action._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A staging system for assessment of recurrent respiratory papillomatosis (RRP). The staging system includes a functional assessment of severity as well as an anatomic assessment of disease distribution. The anatomic score can then be used in combination with the functional assessment to measure an individual patient's clinical course and response to therapy over time.:Glandular or squamous cell neoplastic proliferations characterized by the formation of multiple papillary structures diffusely involving a specific anatomic site.

Concepts.definition: A staging system for assessment of recurrent respiratory papillomatosis (RRP). The staging system includes a functional assessment of severity as well as an anatomic assessment of disease distribution. The anatomic score can then be used in combination with the functional assessment to measure an individual patient's clinical course and response to therapy over time.
Glandular or squamous cell neoplastic proliferations characterized by the formation of multiple papillary structures diffusely involving a specific anatomic site.

Property.preferredDefinition: Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
The result of an action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Curated to support NCI CCR clinical trial.8.11.2016.dmr

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Named locations of or within the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north._The lower pair of vocal folds located below the glottis, which are the primary source of phonation

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
The lower pair of vocal folds located below the glottis, which are the primary source of phonation

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: Either of a pair of small pyramidal laryngeal cartilages that articulate with the lamina of the cricoid cartilage and give attachment to the posterior part of the corresponding vocal ligament and to several muscles.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.

Either of a pair of small pyramidal laryngeal cartilages that articulate with the lamina of the cricoid cartilage and give attachment to the posterior part of the corresponding vocal ligament and to several muscles.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: Either of a pair of small pyramidal laryngeal cartilages that articulate with the lamina of the cricoid cartilage and give attachment to the posterior part of the corresponding vocal ligament and to several muscles.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

Either of a pair of small pyramidal laryngeal cartilages that articulate with the lamina of the cricoid cartilage and give attachment to the posterior part of the corresponding vocal ligament and to several muscles.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: A band of muscular fibers of the oblique arytenoid muscle that extends from the summit of the arytenoid cartilage to the side of the epiglottis and whose action constricts the laryngeal aperture.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
A band of muscular fibers of the oblique arytenoid muscle that extends from the summit of the arytenoid cartilage to the side of the epiglottis and whose action constricts the laryngeal aperture.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.: One of two folds of a mucous membrane spanning the larynx. The two folds aid in breathing and preventing regurgitation to a greater extent than producing sounds.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.
One of two folds of a mucous membrane spanning the larynx. The two folds aid in breathing and preventing regurgitation to a greater extent than producing sounds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The area of the larynx below the vocal cords down to the trachea.

Concepts.definition: The area of the larynx below the vocal cords down to the trachea.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Denoting the back surface of the body; at or near the hind end in quadrupeds or toward the spine in primates.: The space in which the vocal cords are located.

Concepts.definition: Denoting the back surface of the body; at or near the hind end in quadrupeds or toward the spine in primates.
The space in which the vocal cords are located.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The anterior-most portion of the vocal cord, located within the larynx, that constitutes the junction of the conus elasticus and the thyroepiglottic, vestibular, and vocal ligaments.

Concepts.definition: The anterior-most portion of the vocal cord, located within the larynx, that constitutes the junction of the conus elasticus and the thyroepiglottic, vestibular, and vocal ligaments.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north._The lower pair of vocal folds located below the glottis, which are the primary source of phonation

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
The lower pair of vocal folds located below the glottis, which are the primary source of phonation

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: One of two folds of a mucous membrane spanning the larynx. The two folds aid in breathing and preventing regurgitation to a greater extent than producing sounds.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
One of two folds of a mucous membrane spanning the larynx. The two folds aid in breathing and preventing regurgitation to a greater extent than producing sounds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.: A band of muscular fibers of the oblique arytenoid muscle that extends from the summit of the arytenoid cartilage to the side of the epiglottis and whose action constricts the laryngeal aperture.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.
A band of muscular fibers of the oblique arytenoid muscle that extends from the summit of the arytenoid cartilage to the side of the epiglottis and whose action constricts the laryngeal aperture.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having to do with the larynx.: A small cartilagenous flap-like valve that closes over the larynx during swallowing to prevent food entering the lungs.

Concepts.definition: Referring to the larynx.
A small cartilagenous flap-like valve that closes over the larynx during swallowing to prevent food entering the lungs.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Describes a location in the mouth that is toward or near the tongue.: A small cartilagenous flap-like valve that closes over the larynx during swallowing to prevent food entering the lungs.

Concepts.definition: Describes a location in the mouth that is toward or near the tongue.
